Search Inside CSUSB


Search Inside














 
 




‘Eternal Learning’ points to mission of James R. Watson and Judy Rodriguez Watson College of Education
The mural of ceramic will be formally introduced during a ceremony at 11:30 a.m. Wednesday, May 3, at the college. The work was student-designed, student-created and student-installed.

Read More about ‘Eternal Learning’ points to mission of James R. Watson and Judy Rodriguez Watson College of Education









 

 




World languages and literatures professor collaborates with elementary school to present smARTshow
The Robert and Frances Fullerton Museum of Art at CSUSB presents smARTshow, a conceptual art exhibit featuring fourth-grade work from students at Manuel A. Salinas Creative Arts Elementary School. An opening reception will be on Friday, May 5.

Read More about World languages and literatures professor collaborates with elementary school to present smARTshow









 

 




Nominations for CSUSB Alumni Hall of Fame are open till May 7
The three university-wide awards are Distinguished Alumni, Rising Star/Emerging Leader, and Coyote Spirit. The college-linked awards are called the Paw Print Awards. The deadline to submit a nomination is Sunday, May 7, at 11:59 p.m

Read More about Nominations for CSUSB Alumni Hall of Fame are open till May 7









 

 




CSUSB staﬀ and faculty celebrate philanthropy at the Oﬃce of Annual Giving’s luncheon
This year’s annual Faculty and Staff Giving Campaign raised nearly $107,000 with donations from more than 420 faculty, staff and retirees.

Read More about CSUSB staﬀ and faculty celebrate philanthropy at the Oﬃce of Annual Giving’s luncheon









 

 




CSUSB appoints Shareef Amer to lead Coyote Athletics 
Amer joins The Pack after having served in an executive leadership capacity in athletics at California State Northridge, which he joined in 2018.

Read More about CSUSB appoints Shareef Amer to lead Coyote Athletics 









 

 




Use of asset civil forfeiture laws to fund anti-drug policing topic of May 2 program
“Paid for by Crime: Civil Asset Forfeiture and the War on Drugs,” with Kenneth Alyass, a Ph.D. candidate in history at Harvard University, will be presented at 1 p.m. Tuesday, May 2, on Zoom.

Read More about Use of asset civil forfeiture laws to fund anti-drug policing topic of May 2 program









 

 




CSUSB sociology professor institutes 'homegrown' experiences into his teaching
José Muñoz, CSUSB associate professor of sociology, holds many roles on and off campus, all with the purpose of serving students and faculty members.

Read More about CSUSB sociology professor institutes 'homegrown' experiences into his teaching

Watch Video about CSUSB sociology professor institutes 'homegrown' experiences into his teaching




 Download Video Transcript for CSUSB sociology professor institutes 'homegrown' experiences into his teaching









 

 




CSUSB Model UN program ultimate goal to develop hopeful, vocal scholars
The university’s Model United Nations program continued its tradition of excellence when it brought home Distinguished Delegation honors while representing Austria at the prestigious National Model United Nations Conference in New York City.

Read More about CSUSB Model UN program ultimate goal to develop hopeful, vocal scholars









 

 




CSUSB ranked among best graduate schools in the nation by U.S. News & World Report
CSUSB has been named among the nation’s top universities in 2023-24 as nine of its programs have been listed among the best in the nation according to U.S. News & World Report.

Read More about CSUSB ranked among best graduate schools in the nation by U.S. News & World Report









 

 




Sheriff credits CSUSB education in helping to develop his leadership skills
With nearly a 40-year career in law enforcement, San Bernardino County Sheriff and CSUSB alumnus Shannon Dicus credits his college education for not only helping to develop his leadership skills, but also a better, more well-rounded understanding of life.

Read More about Sheriff credits CSUSB education in helping to develop his leadership skills









 

 




Rep. Aguilar presents $2 million check to CSUSB Master of Science in Physician Assistant program
The federal funding will help purchase state-of-the-art equipment, lab equipment and support and renovate the CSUSB Yasuda Center, which will house the MSPA program.

Read More about Rep. Aguilar presents $2 million check to CSUSB Master of Science in Physician Assistant program









 

 




Student to pursue career in biomedical engineering with the goal of becoming a researcher in ulcerative colitis 
Jacob Lacy will graduate in May with a bachelor’s degree in physics and plans on attending the University of Vermont biomedical engineering Ph.D. program to ultimately become a professor in the field and a researcher in ulcerative colitis.

Read More about Student to pursue career in biomedical engineering with the goal of becoming a researcher in ulcerative colitis 









 

 




Professor emeritus of Jewish Communal Services talks about 21st Century American Judaism
Jewish communal service professor emeritus Steven Windmueller presented “Reflections on a Revolution: Unpacking 21st Century American Judaism” at the 2023 Rabbi Hillel Cohn Lecture Series on the Contemporary Jewish Experience. 

Read More about Professor emeritus of Jewish Communal Services talks about 21st Century American Judaism









 

 




CSUSB announces Meeting of the Minds Student Research Symposium winners
The Meeting of the Minds Student Research Symposium, part of CSUSB’s Research Week, showcases the research and creative activities of graduate and undergraduate students from throughout the university.

Read More about CSUSB announces Meeting of the Minds Student Research Symposium winners









 

 




CSUSB theatre department ends the 2022-23 season with a family-friendly musical
Children of all ages will enjoy “Anansi’s Carnival Adventure,” an enchanting, environmentally conscious production, enhanced with song, interpretive dance, colorful costumes, elaborate masks, painted set pieces and animated projections that bring the story to life! The musical opened April 28 runs through May 7.

Read More about CSUSB theatre department ends the 2022-23 season with a family-friendly musical









 









Main Content Region



CSUSB News














Spotlight
















April 28, 2023
San Bernardino County to hold Resource Recovery Fair at CSUSB on May 3
Offered in association with the Anthropology Museum’s current INTO LIGHT exhibition, the San Bernardino County Department of Behavioral Health’s Resource Recovery Fair will provide resources that can be shared with those battling substance use disorder.























April 24, 2023

College Assistance Migrant Program at CSUSB Palm Desert Campus is helping students succeed in college

In its first year, the program is already making great strides in helping students in the Coachella Valley pursue a higher education.













April 21, 2023

CSUSB professor publishes ‘Handbook of Research on Andragogical Leadership and Technology in a Modern World’

This is the 57th refereed book by Viktor Wang, associate professor of educational leadership and technology, and covers topics such as andragogical leadership, instructional technology, and digital andragogy.













April 19, 2023

CSUSB professor to be honored at Leading While Female Conference on April 21-22

Angela Clark-Louque joined CSUSB in 2000 and had served as department chair of Educational Leadership and Technology.
